alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Fairfield; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:46AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD, SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE AND WESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 315 AM EDT... At 245 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Westerville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Pickerington, Worthington, Bexley, Granville, Pataskala, Powell, Canal Winchester, Johnstown, Sunbury, Minerva Park, Granville South, Beechwood Trails, and Polaris. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio near mile marker 103, and between mile markers 106 and 125. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 110 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
